Posts.Content: Another picture... better this time. No change doctor still 'doesnt know' although assures me it is not a lymph node... anyone got any ideas? It's about 3-4cm vertically by 0.7cm horizontally. http://img218.imageshack.us/img218/3353/aplinabs.gif
Posts.Title: Lump in right side of chest - Picture Included

Posts.Content: Hey guys, A little worried because I have recently found a lump in my chest. I do box semi-professionally and obviously use my chest muscles quite a lot for punching, pressups, weights, etc. However this lump feels quite hard, I know the picture is hard to see because of the flash, but the lump is about 4cm long and 1cm wide, kind of like a quarter of a pencil size. It's not 'hard' but it is also not soft, it is kind of like a solid rubber feeling. I am going to doctors but am not home for 12 days, so was hoping someone could offer advice as to if this could be serious (I know the 100% worst case senario would be cancer) or just muscle related. I don't mean the horizontal bump across the top of my chest, I know what that is. I mean the verticle one on the right side... I realise it is hard to see in that pic Thanks guys... Link to picture : http://img9.imageshack.us/img9/9045/chestlump.gif
Posts.Title: Lump in right side of chest - Picture Included

Posts.Content: I am sure people interested in discussing breast cancer are comfortable seeing a picture of an adult males chest in order to advise them medically!?
Posts.Title: Lump in right side of chest - Picture Included

Posts.Content: Just been doctors and I got the 'Wait and see' treatment. I saw his notes and he wrote: 12mm by 2-3mm mass in pectoral major Gotta go back in 4 weeks if nothing changes =/
